original: Belfrage, Erik Gustaf, praktiserande läkare, Göteborg, f. 25/6/79 i Gbg av mied. dr Fritz B. o. Hildur Ingeborg Traneus. G. 1. 10 m. Olga Eva Eufemia Almqvist, d. 28; 2. 31 m. Aina Almqvist. Barn: Inga f. 11, Karl Erik 13, Ulila 15, Fritz Henrik 17. — Mog:ex. i Gbg 98, med. fil. ex. 99, med. kand. 03, med. lic. 08, allt i Upps. Tf. und:läk. v. Hålahuks sanat. 05, aman. o. assist, v. patolog, inst. i Upps.» 06, aman. v. med. o. pediatr. poliklin. i Upps. 07-08 o. v. med. klin. 08, aman. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. med. avd. 09, prakt, läk. i Gbg sed. 09, läk. v. tullverket i Gbg 11-45. Led. av styr. f. Allm. Pens:- o. Änkekassan där sed. 18. RVO.
translated: Belfrage, Erik Gustaf, practicing physician in Gothenburg, born June 25th, 1879 in Gothenburg to medical doctor Fritz B. and Hildur Ingeborg Traneus. Married first to Olga Eva Eufemia Almqvist in 1910 until her death in 1928, then to Aina Almqvist in 1931. Children: Inga (born 1911), Karl Erik (born 1913), Ulla (born 1915), Fritz Henrik (born 1917). Completed his Bachelor of Arts degree in Gothenburg in 1898, Bachelor of Science in Medicine in 1899, Bachelor of Medicine in 1903, and Doctor of Medicine in 1908, all at Uppsala University. Substitute medical officer at Hålahuks sanatorium in 1905, assistant and associate at the pathological institute in Uppsala in 1906, assistant at the medical and pediatric polyclinic in Uppsala from 1907-1908, assistant at the Sahlgr. Hospital medical department in 1909. Practicing physician in Gothenburg since 1909, physician at the customs office in Gothenburg from 1911-1945. Member of the board of the General Pension and Widow's Fund since 1918. Recipient of the Order of Vasa.
